explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 requires that the third clause of a for statement modify only the loop counter and shall not use objects that are modified in the for-loop body. In the code the third clause is off += (size_t) ret — it reads ret, but ret is assigned inside the loop body (ret = send(...); and ret = 0 in the EAGAIN branch). Because ret is modified by the loop body, using it in the third clause violates clause 3 of Rule 14.2. (Workarounds include restructuring to a while loop or ensuring the third-clause expression depends only on the loop counter.)
